NavTools 2021.06¶

NavTools helps with planning, execution and analysis of simple waypoint-based navigation using rhumb-line routes. It’s suitable for small craft making relatively short passages where the great circle accuracy isn’t critical.

This is focused on Python 3.9.

  • navtools.lowrance_usr – Lowrance USR File Parser
  • navtools.olc – OLC Geocoding
  • navtools.waypoint_merge – Waypoint and Route Merge
  • navtools.igrf11 – International Geomagnetic Reference Field Module

The TODO List¶

If you have PySerial installed, you could write applications to read common GPS devices and decode the messages. This would allow you to track waypoints, and possibly even build an anchor alarm monitor.

Todo

Refactor the sniffing out of csv_to_LogEntry.

There should be two, separate, csv readers for files with headers and a separate one for files without headers, where a default header is assumed or the analysis main program provides a header.

(The original entry is located in /Users/slott/github/local/navtools/navtools/analysis.py:docstring of navtools.analysis.csv_to_LogEntry, line 16.)

Todo

Refactor to eliminate (if possible) sniffing the source_row keys to create CSV headers.

Option 1. Replace with a class. An iterator method to update the source_row with LogEntry_Rhumb and accumulated sub-totals. Essentially, build_row_dict. A method to write CSV preserving original headers and adding new headers based on values computed by the iterator.

Option 2. The client provides the source_row keys, doing the sniffing for us.

(The original entry is located in /Users/slott/github/local/navtools/navtools/analysis.py:docstring of navtools.analysis.write_csv, line 18.)

Todo

Use urllib2

We can then use urllib instead of simple Path.open() so that we could use “file:///path/to/file” or “https://server/path/to/file”.

Most use cases involve disconnected computers, with a statically downloaded file, it’s easy to cover all the bases by opening a URL.

The official file: http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/IAGA/vmod/igrf11coeffs.txt

(The original entry is located in /Users/slott/github/local/navtools/navtools/igrf11.py:docstring of navtools.igrf11.IGRF11.load_coeffs, line 19.)

Todo

Refactor OpenCPN Table to reuse elements of navigation

(The original entry is located in /Users/slott/github/local/navtools/docs/opencpn_table.rst, line 12.)
